developerResponse: {'id': 30466232, 'body': 'It‚Äôs great to hear you found our sleep recorder and tracker helpful. review: I am so grateful for this app. I keep odd sleep hours and they fluctuate weekly. This app is teaching me better sleeP Habits. I worked so much for years at all different hours of the day that I just got used to sleeping two or three hours a night. Because of the programs, music, meditation and stories I‚Äôm sleeping more at the same time. And even at night. I‚Äôve stopped having to take a nap. If I get tired, I find something else to unpack clean and repack.  It keeps me moving.  Their guidance was good in the free portion of the app there are still alot of choices for sleeping, but after paying the fee for premium, I‚Äôm getting one-on-one help. I‚Äôm  getting an analysis of my sleeping habits. It has opened my eyes.  It‚Äôs been over 90 days and I slept five hours straight last night guys. but listen to this. I got up walked around taking deep breathes and got a drink of water. I laid back down and closed my eyes. When I awoke, 4 hours had gone by. That‚Äôs the most of slept in 24 hours over the past 50 years.  I sleep better and I feel better. I just needed to realize that I‚Äôm not in a hurry to do anything anymore and I only have to make myself happy. If you really want to take your sleeping problem under hand, try this app for thirty days. See what happens.  Deep breath.     Love this app and those who have given their precious time to me. Thank you.
title: Blessings

developerResponse: {'id': 31590667, 'body': 'Thank you very much for your feedback! We are glad to hear that ShutEye was able to help you and hope that your sleep quality is getting better and better!', 'modified': '2022-08-22T09:13:35Z'}
review: I had always had trouble sleeping at night and waking up feeling tired as if I never slept at all. This has always been happening since I moved into this house. After purchasing this app, I quickly became shocked as to what it was capturing at night for the audio. I would hear other peoples voices talking to me keeping me somewhat awake at night. I was never conscious enough to realize this was going on. At first I thought the app was just adding fake audio to make it seem like a special feature so I ended up setting up a camera to record myself sleep in addition to the recording audio from the app. Not only was the app extremely accurate, my camera captured paranormal activity occurring with the audio. My blankets would be pulled off of me, my head would get hit into the wall by force, and I would even get up and stand in front of whatever this was and talk to it. Extremely scary stuff but grateful this app actually worked so well to help me realize what has been going on
title: Caught Voices from Ghosts at Night

review:
I bought a year subscription to try it out since the one week free trial isn‚Äôt enough. After having it for 40 days, I‚Äôm not impressed. It ‚Äútracks‚Äù every little thing. The recordings aren‚Äôt accurate and you can‚Äôt correct the information yourself except delete the recordings. Says I have bruxism when I wear a mouth guard to prevent bruxism. And the recording literally heard nothing. Not exactly sure how it knows when you‚Äôve fallen asleep or gone into deep sleep without tracking your heart rate or movements. All it‚Äôs doing is listening for sounds. Last night it said I fell asleep in an hour. I know that‚Äôs not possible because I was extremely tired and normally fall asleep in <15min. on regular nights. Don‚Äôt waste your money. If you want a real sleep tracker, invest in a Garmin or an Oura ring. Might be more expensive for a one time upfront cost, but at least you‚Äôll get accurate consistent data. I‚Äôm only giving this 2 stars because I do like the sounds features. Other than that, the app is useless and unless there‚Äôs a way they can start tracking your HR there‚Äôs nothing this app can do to improve.

review: This is such an awesome app. I forget how I stumbled upon it but it‚Äôs a good one. Not great but pretty good. I am currently using a competitors sleep app at a premium level and I really like it but Shut Eye looked interesting so I took it for a test ride. I love all the sounds and stories and that stuff. I love all the reports. Pretty darn accurate. But here‚Äôs the deal breaker for me. I need to use a sleep app that knows when I‚Äôm sleeping and knows when I‚Äôm up in the morning. You have to manually tell this app you are going to bed. And then I need to manually turn the alarm off (every night) because I don‚Äôt need to be waking my wife at 3:30am. And then I need to tell the Shut Eye app that I‚Äôm up. And I forgot a few times to say I‚Äôm up in my trial (which I wish was 14 days since I forgot to start the app two nights and never saw how the app really works before the trial expired) Nope, I need an app that talks to my watch. I need an app that wakes me on my watch with a vibration, not have an alarm go off that wakes my wife and the dogs. I need a sleep app that is smart enough to know I‚Äôm in bed and an app that is smart enough to know I‚Äôm up for good. If this app ever syncs with my watch I‚Äôll pay a lifetime premium for the app. But as it is, I can‚Äôt use it. I‚Äôm used to my current sleep app that works all by itself with no manual input from me. Sorry.

I was able to shut my phone down buy pushing every side button at the same time. To be honest I expected this app to be so much more. It doesn‚Äôt give you a sleep score and when it tells you that it tells you when you talk in your sleep and so on. It gets it all wrong. This app needs a lot more improvement in order to tell when your awake or Animal noises is me struggling to breathe. I guess the way I look at it is this needs a lot more work because it can tell you if you have sleep apnea or not. The first night it said I had mild sleep apnea but the next night was severe and the following night it was call a doctor immediately. Just so everyone knows I am aware I have severe sleep apnea. I can not wear those masks over my face I feel like I‚Äôm suffocating.
title: I have severe Sleep Apnea

review:
People, stop believing this nonsense! I gave this two stars instead of one because I enjoyed the white noise options. However, when this app says you were in deepest sleep for the two hours you were *awake and moving around*, it‚Äôs bull. I made noise, they can‚Äôt claim I was ‚Äútoo quiet‚Äù. And the patterns of sleep were nearly identical every night, which is suspicious. There is NO WAY for any app based on sound to know where you are in your sleep. That‚Äôs ridiculous. And please, Shut Eye team, don‚Äôt give me your pat responses I read elsewhere like, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre sorry you had this experience.‚Äù (No, you‚Äôre not.) Or ‚ÄúThank you for bringing it to our attention and we‚Äôre doing our best to resolve this issue.‚Äù (No, you‚Äôre not, because you CAN‚ÄôT. Sound simply does not indicate depth of sleep!) Now, if you just sold all the great white noise sounds for one fixed price, I might actually do that!

EDIT: As you can see from their response, it‚Äôs a ‚Äòbot reply. No humans are engaging here. It says they‚Äôll ‚Äútake my suggestion into consideration‚Äù. There is no suggestion. So not only is an app based on sound no way to truly measure the quality of your sleep, they don‚Äôt even have humans paying attention.

We take giving users a positive experience seriously, so we value feedback like you immensely. Thanks again.', 'modified': '2021-11-23T06:47:17Z'}
review: This app has been super useful for me in tracking my sleep while in the process of adjusting medications! However, there‚Äôs one major problem that I have with it: it effectively assumes that the time between you waking up and you stopping the app is just you forgetting to turn it off. This has been a major issue for tracking my sleep quality, because a lot of the time, the actual scenario is ‚ÄúI woke up several hours earlier than I intended to, lay in bed trying to fall back asleep for two hours, and then gave up.‚Äù This results in the app thinking my sleep quality as lower on days where I AM successful in falling back asleep than the days where I‚Äôm not, which is obviously a major issue when my goal is to track insomnia. Would absolutely change this to 5 stars if the app developers added a way to tell the app whether you were awake but forgot to turn it off or you were trying to sleep the whole time it was running, and adjusted sleep quality accordingly.

We take giving users a positive experience seriously, so we value feedback like you immensely. Thank you for the feedback.', 'modified': '2022-08-25T10:44:38Z'}
review:
While this app has a few nice things like music, white noise and the ability to record your snoring and farting, it can‚Äôt possibly know when you are actually asleep or in REM sleep; so their sleep statistics are truly misleading. It‚Äôs cute; but it isn‚Äôt what you think it is. In the end, this is nothing more than a novelty. 

When it comes to rating the app, you will be bombarded with annoying pop-ups that give you two options: 1) Rate it highly 2) Continue to be bothered by persistent pop-ups. Because if this, you absolutely cannot trust the high marks this app receives in the App Store. That alone should tell you that this app is not entirely what it purports to be. This method of rating must absolutely be changed. I only wish I had a convenient way to report this misleading rating scheme to Apple. Until a change is made,  the app owners will continue to mislead prospective subscribers. For that reason alone, you should be leery about downloading this app. (My question to the app developers is why don‚Äôt you trust your users to rate this app without only giving them the option of giving it a high rating in your pop-ups?)
title: Useless for the most part

review: I like the idea of being able to listen to what you‚Äôve said, done, and if they‚Äôre‚Äôs anything you should be worried about or call a doctor about but you can only listen to barely any of the clips as the rest are hidden until you subscribe which most people either can‚Äôt or don‚Äôt want to, for me both. developerResponse: {'id': 27631563, 'body': 'Thanks for your feedback, I‚Äôm so sorry that our sleep tracker can‚Äôt track two people‚Äôs sleep at the same time now. ShutEye recognizes, calculates, and analyzes the files recorded by the microphone through artificial intelligence algorithms to produce your sleep status information. So two people‚Äôs noise may be regarded as one‚Äôs noise now. We consider adding a feature like this in a future update. Stay tuned, and thanks so much for helping us improve our product.', 'modified': '2022-01-24T15:02:44Z'}
review:
I really like the app so far but I don‚Äôt see how it will work for me personally. I‚Äôm open to suggestions as maybe there is something I‚Äôm not aware of. 

So far, it‚Äôs combining the sleep of my husband and I. The tracker shows I am in deep sleep when in fact I‚Äôm wide awake listening to my husband snore. And it recorded him coming in from work and taking medication as me teeth grinding and in deep sleep. Nope. While I am able to mark the recordings as errors, it would be nice to be able to make a quick note of why it‚Äôs an error (not my snore, I‚Äôm awake, that‚Äôs a pill bottle). It seems to me this feedback would help shuteye better identify the noises it hears to track better. I‚Äôm exhausted from little sleep and yet it states I was asleep 6:17 of the 7 I was in bed. In fact I was awake much more and walking around at a time it tells me I was deep sleeping. I‚Äôm confused but there must be a better way.
title: A few kinks but I really like it

review:
The good: the app has a large library of articles about sleep as well as a plethora of stories, music and sounds that you can listen to to help you fall asleep.

The not-so-good: The sleep tracker. On the surface, it‚Äôs pretty cool. It records the environment so you get a recording of things like how much and how loud you snore, as well as hearing anything else that went on during the night. It‚Äôs also supposed to track when you‚Äôre asleep vs awake as well as telling you how much time and when you spent time in deep sleep or light sleep. The problem is, it doesn‚Äôt work. Last night for example, I woke up multiple times. Physically got out of bed two of those times, and even picked up my phone a couple times to check the time. When I awoke for the day and checked my sleep log, it said I was out cold the entire night. That‚Äôs not helpful and frankly makes me question the accuracy of the deep sleep vs light sleep data.
title: Sleep tracker needs work

title: Shut eye

developerResponse: {'id': 20820486, 'body': 'Thank you for the feedback, we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration, we are always looking for new ways to continue improving.\r\n', 'modified': '2021-02-03T03:11:51Z'}
review:
Good:

This app does better than others I‚Äôve tried at actually recording noises during the night. They are usually miscategorized, but that is not a huge issue. 

Neutral:

It does an okay job of actually tracking sleep. It‚Äôs accuracy is far from perfect. It often ‚Äúmisses‚Äù my wake ups during the night, for example. But it‚Äôs at least as good as other trackers I‚Äôve tried and maybe a bit better. 

Bad:

It‚Äôs impossible to change their suggestions. It asked me what my ideal sleep schedule would be. However, my ideal is not realistic (since my job wants me there at 8 AM not 1 PM!). I didn‚Äôt realize I would never be able to change. The app now thinks I should go to bed at 1:30 and get up at 9. I could that for a couple days before getting fired maybe. 

It is very naggy. Get up when you wake up that‚Äôs 30 minutes earlier than usual? Nag. Go to bed earlier or later? Nag. I get that consistency is good, but this seems to be totalitarian in outlook. 

Speaking of totalitarian, the text suffers from a subpar English translation. It‚Äôs easily understandable, but just different enough to make you recall that it is, in fact, translated. It makes me wonder how safe my data is. 

Summary:

I probably won‚Äôt renew this when it comes due. It is okay, but for me the lack of customizability/flexibility outweighs the decent recording ability. I will look for another solution down the road.
title: Pretty Good Recording Quality

developerResponse: {'id': 35853391, 'body': 'Hi Muzzie, one reason for the discrepancy might be that the app records time spent asleep, not time in bed. Taking this into account, if you still feel Sleep Tracker has shut off prematurely, this might be caused by insufficient phone charge. Please be sure that your phone is plugged in while using Sleep Tracker.  ', 'modified': '2023-04-10T02:39:12Z'}
review:
Although this app has helped me identify a snoring issue, it is not accurate in tracking when I am actually asleep. For example: it tracked that I fell asleep in 9 minutes, when I was actually awake. It showed I was either in deep sleep or light sleep when I had actually gotten out of bed. I started speaking during these times and started getting clips of me ‚Äútalking in my sleep‚Äù saying things like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm awake now‚Äù. I‚Äôm pretty dubious about it‚Äôs ability to know that I‚Äôm asleep, let alone the depth of sleep I am in.

::::::::follow up:::::::::::

I received this response from the developer: "Hi Muzzie, one reason for the discrepancy might be that the app records time spent asleep, not time in bed. Taking this into account, if you still feel Sleep Tracker has shut off prematurely, this might be caused by insufficient phone charge. Please be sure that your phone is plugged in while using Sleep Tracker. "

lt seems that this is a response to a completely different review, as I never said the sleep tracker turned off. What I said was the sleep tracker could not discern if I were awake or asleep, as evidenced by the fact that it used clips of me saying things like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm awake now, just for the record‚Äù as examples of me ‚Äútalking in my sleep‚Äù.  It reported that I was asleep when I was clearly awake.  Not once, but several times. 

So again, not this app is NOT an accurate tracker of sleep patterns.
title: Not EXACTLY accurate tracking

review: I have a habit of waking up in the middle of the night and being unable to fall back asleep for hours. Often times I will get on my phone to scroll or to look for music/white noise to help me fall back asleep. This app would be so much more helpful if it could tell when you have picked up/unlocked/or are using your phone. I was awake last night from about 2:30 to nearly 5 and for over an hour of that time, though I was actively using my phone, this app recorded it as deep sleep. I will also wake up and try to turn on sounds within this app to encourage me to fall back asleep and it doesn‚Äôt even seem to recognize that use as wakefulness, despite me clicking around in the app. Until that issue can be fixed this is a mediocre app at best, especially if you‚Äôre unwilling to pay for premium features (like me).
title: Does not identify true awake status

title: Ok at best

review: I like the concept however I find the app is way off. I paid for the year so it is what it is. I wish there was a way to make your own notes to help correct recordings or gathered data to differintiate between one or more sleepers. Unfortunately the app tends to pick up my husbands snoring over mine most of the time even though he is further from the phone. I just wish there was a better way of gathering data!!!
title: Great Concept but.......

developerResponse: {'id': 29976673, 'body': 'Thank you for the feedback, we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration, we are always looking for new ways to continue improving.', 'modified': '2022-05-26T06:54:36Z'}
review: I have the same issues so many others here have mentioned: It tells me I took 45 minutes to fall asleep when I know I was out cold in under ten. It doesn't register when I wake up in the middle of the night and can't go back to sleep for an hour or longer. It doesn't register when I get up in the middle of the night and walk out of the room. Customer service isn't great. I reached out because I couldn't access some of the premium features I'm paying for and the suggestion was to uninstall the app (thereby losing my data) and reinstall. If it were free, I wouldn't mind so much, but it's not. And to the point someone made about a longer free trial? If I'd had a longer free trial I likely would not have subscribed because I would have seen the repetitive flaws‚ÄîI'm betting some marketing guru somewhere knows that. I won't be renewing my subscription. I had such high hopes too....
title: Meh. Just "okay"

review: Shuteye has helped me so much! My husband of 40 years passed away recently, and I was having horrible insomnia. Out of desperation, I downloaded four or five different sleep apps. The best one, by far, is ShutEye. I have since deleted the others. ShutEye is amazing. It tracks all my sleep stages, records sounds, has countless choices of relaxing sounds and music, meditations, and bedtime stories. I actually enjoy and look forward to my bedtime routine now. I went from 0-4 hours of sleep per night up to eight full hours, and I wake up refreshed and full of energy now. I am recommending ShutEye to everyone I know! Do the free trial, and I guarantee you will want to keep it.

review: I‚Äôm really not impressed with this app. To start off with, I always play rain/storm sounds while I sleep. The first night I turned on this app, it was fairly decent. On the second night, I hit the button to start recording and laid my phone down on my nightstand. Well, the pop up for rating the app I guess came up after I started. So nothing was recorded that night‚Ä¶. Then, the last two nights, I suppose it‚Äôs the sounds of the rain or thunder that are throwing off the app because it‚Äôs saying I got very minimal sleep. I would think that it could tell the difference between me actually being the one making noises all night and the sleep music, especially considering the app has sleep music as well. review: I fell asleep pretty much instantly with the light on and the computer still being used. Also I fell asleep waaay before the time I usually fall asleep (I usually fall asleep at midnight on weekdays and 1:00 - 3:00 on weekends). I did sleep past the alarm but that is mostly my fault. I rested very well my first night using it and it did record the noises I made during the night. So, you may be wondering, why did you give it four stars if you loved it? Well, it was completely vertical. When I tried to rate my sleep, I was asked between horrible and mediocre. I tried swiping (I‚Äôm using an iPad, btw), but nothing happened. I rated mediocre, of course, as it was the best rating I could choose between. So, that is my review of Shuteye. Pretty much amazing app. Four stars out of five.
title: Almost perfect, but‚Ä¶

review: I‚Äôve been using this now for several months. There‚Äôs a couple of things that really make me frustrated. One is in the recommended activities to do before going to bed. It has a guided meditation that you can‚Äôt select a different one. It has just one standard one that I am supposed to do nightly, and I cannot stand that one. I wish I had more of the other options that I could use to improve my sleep score. Also, when there‚Äôs a seasonal time change it counts the hours of sleep incorrectly. And, when myself or my husband because we are both using it have insomnia in the middle of the night there‚Äôs no way to pause the app to demonstrate that we are actually wide awake for a while. often it records instead that that was a period of deep sleep.
title: Not worth the money, but interesting

review:
I don‚Äôt usually write reviews for apps, but I‚Äôve had such a bad experience with this one that I had to share it. 
I have contacted the developers 3 times requesting to cancel my subscription (because for some reason you can‚Äôt cancel this one through Apple like you can with every other app subscription). So you have to do it through the app itself which is annoying but not a huge deal, until you try to do that. The FAQ has a question about how to cancel. The answer is essentially, email us and we‚Äôll do our best to solve your issue. Apparently my issue of wanting to cancel doesn‚Äôt fit their description of an issue, since it‚Äôs now been another month and another payment, with multiple emails into their stated email address and I have heard NOTHING! Not even and acknowledgement that I reached out. That‚Äôs a total scam and I would never give these people my money after this!

review:
The one thing I like about this app is the variety of sounds you can use with the free trial.

However, the actual sleep tracking is inaccurate. My chart says I have fallen asleep in less than 15 mins, which I know is not true because I always have trouble falling asleep. Even the times when I look at the time on my phone after tossing and turning the chart does not log that I was awake. Also, I usually wake up to use the restroom every night, and sometimes the app doesn‚Äôt even log that I woke up. Additionally, sometimes I will wake up before my alarm, and the app doesn‚Äôt track it. Finally, a lot of the recorded sounds are absolutely nothing (humming of my fan, etc.). 

Overall, it seems that the app think I fall asleep immediately when I turn the sleep mode on, wake up when the alarm goes off, and only listens for big noise to signify that I am awake.
title: Inaccurate

title: This app is only good for sleep recording and waking up

review:
My main issue with this app is that, when I have it active (i.e. I set an alarm or use the sleep aid feature), I don‚Äôt get text messages or calls.  Considering my job starts early morning, around 4am, it‚Äôs kinda important that my bosses are able to contact me‚Äî especially if I‚Äôve overslept or someone called off and they‚Äôre asking me to cover.  And my friends sometimes need to get ahold of me at a time when I‚Äôm usually asleep, and not being able to know they‚Äôre calling/messaging at all is very bad.  
Other than that, I like the sleep sounds and the wake-up music‚Äî though some ASMR more along the lines of kinetic sand cutting and stuff like that would be nice.
title: Renders you incommunicado while using the app

While the app is ‚Äòunique ‚Äò, it often misinterprets sounds.  I also don‚Äôt see how a phone that‚Äôs not physically connected to you can tell that you‚Äôre not asleep.  I often get scores that make no sense.   I wake up at 5:15 after sleeping through the night and the app says I was awake for over 2 hours (????).  I don‚Äôt really trust the results.

We take giving users a positive experience seriously, so we value feedback like you immensely. Thanks again. ', 'modified': '2022-10-12T03:23:45Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had this app for 50 days and at first it was great, I‚Äôm not sure how it actually tracks your sleep because it was mostly giving me a very wavy graph. 

It also wasn‚Äôt picking up that I was awake when someone came in to talk to me early in the morning, and the app recorded both voices. I wasn‚Äôt worried about this because I usually fall asleep quickly afterwards, and it didn‚Äôt effect my overall sleep. 

The past week it has been changing my sleep graph so much that I wake up from a 8-9 hr night to a 0-50 sleep score because it thinks I only slept for 45 minutes to an hour. 

Also every time you open the app it shows you the offer to buy premium, often giving a deal. You can not use the app until you exit the ad, and sometimes you have to wait for the wheel to spin and land on jackpot before the X pops up. Once I‚Äôve initially declined the premium membership I don‚Äôt want to continue to see pop ups about it. There are some features that are unavailable without premium (which is fine by me), and in opening these one could go about purchasing the premium. We don‚Äôt need it shoved in our faces every time we open the app when we‚Äôre trying to go to sleep.
title: Does not accurately track sleep patterns

title: Bit Disappointed

review: I have an Apple Watch, and have been closely watching my blood oxygen, respiratory rates, and pulse, and was hoping for a program that would correlate this data with the different sleep stages. Instead this program, when notifications are turned on, reminds me to eat chicken (vegetarian) or take a hot bath even though that would potentially cause more side effects if you have MA and thus poor sleep. Rifling through a drawer at night is labeled bruxism, saying good night is labeled snoring, and no analysis is released until they have a full week of sleep. I set an alarm not knowing that I would be created an adorable terrier puppy hopping back-and-forth across the screen. Compared to programs that wake you up during your light sleep stages, a puppy is a little overwhelming, lol.

review:
My work hours require me to get up at 4AM. All my life I've been a "night person". With the help from this app, I'm getting more attuned to my sleep life and adjusting myself to those waking hours. I used to keep "teenager hours" on weekends and sleep in until 10-11. Now I'm getting up at 6 and feel fine with it. 
The one suggestion I'd make is improvement of sound identification. Every morning I wake to app reports of "teeth grinding". When I listen back, it's obvious that the app is picking up my bed frame creaking when I change positions. I've been reporting it as inaccurate. Just hoping this message will bring some further awareness to the need for more refinement.

We take giving users a positive experience seriously, so we value feedback like you immensely. Thanks again.', 'modified': '2020-10-09T08:03:40Z'}
review:
First off, I missed where they said they were gonna charge me $60. That was a surprise. (I guess that‚Äôs the perk of an app that you use when you are you‚Äôre most tired. 

Second, the app stopped working after only a few days. It records nothing now, even when I know I‚Äôve had a conversation. It also isn‚Äôt even recording the correct time anymore. I work 3rd shift and have an odd sleep schedule. Last ‚Äúnight‚Äù I started the app around 9 am and slept until 5 pm. The app shows I slept 12:51 am-6:51 am...

Third, the meditations restart when they‚Äôve finished playing. There have been times that I‚Äôve been right on the edge of sleep and the meditation restarts, waking me up. 

Fourth, the wake up feature DOES NOT work for me. If I do not set a backup alarm, I will not wake up. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs even going off or just so subtle that I don‚Äôt hear it or what.

Fifth, many times when I do finally wake up, the app is already off and only tracked for about 30 minutes. 

While hearing the sounds that occur while I‚Äôm sleeping was neat, it is definitely not $60 neat. And my FitBit does a much better job at ACTUALLY tracking my sleep.
title: Stopped working after a few days

review:

 I don‚Äôt think this actually ‚Äútracks‚Äù my sleep because I can be awake and rolling around bed literally all night and this app will say I slept like a rock. Also when I get out of bed to go potty, it just thinks I was really quiet for a moment. Could we add a pause button maybe? Ontop of that, usually I end up taking sleep meds or warm milk after I‚Äôve been trying to sleep for a while and it‚Äôs not working. Could we add an update button? And what if I sleep on the couch for some reason? There‚Äôs a ‚Äúnew bed‚Äù option, but nothing for a couch or something like that. What if someone stays the night? There‚Äôs no option for sharing a bed. I smoke weed to sleep sometimes, where‚Äôs that option? 

Would it track my sleep better if I put my phone on my bed or in my bed frame rather than the bedside table? 

All in all, it‚Äôs a fantastic app to help you fall asleep and wake up, but not great at actually tracking your sleep patterns.

review:
This is definitely the best of all the apps out there, but it still suffers from one unfortunate issue and that is that the loops are too short. 

For many of the sounds this is ok and you can‚Äôt tell, but for some of the nature sounds like rain and waves etc it ruins the experience. The culprit is always one very specific sound within the loop that sticks out like a sore thumb. Once you hear it, good luck trying not to focus on it and wait for it to return 15 or so seconds later. 

If someone could give a little more love to the loops this would easily be a 5 star app. And if they need someone to point out the issues specifically, I‚Äôm the guy!
title: Loops are too short

review: I primarily downloaded this app to detect snoring, which it does quite well.  The sleep tracker itself gives me no confidence in its accuracy. I also use a wearable fitness device that tracks sleep based on heartbeat and respiration. I trust that device much more than this app, which tracks based on what? Sound? I get very different results from each device. I trust the one that uses actual data. Also the sleep meditations get 3 stars at best. Their narrators are horrible, and sometimes the background is louder than the narration. I paid for the 30 day subscription but have already cancelled it after less then 2 weeks. Time to search again‚Ä¶.

review: I downloaded this app as I was searching to find out why I was ALWAYS TIRED. title: Life changing

I‚Äôm still in the trial phase, probably not going to keep it. I‚Äôve learned better sleep habits but it doesn‚Äôt seem to track my sleep. 

Never fallen asleep to a sound machine before. My husband said he slept so well on my first night. The second, he fell asleep before me so I turned it on and managed to fall asleep fast before I did my normal night time routine to get tired. 
Also, I am awful in the mornings. 3 alarms, I‚Äôll snooze for over an hour, and still struggle to get out of bed. I risked it and set this alarm for the gradual wake up at my last usual alarm time. While I still didn‚Äôt want to get out of bed, I was easily awake!

For the sleep tracking, not one clip I‚Äôve listened to has been me. It is all my husband so I‚Äôm not getting any information on my sleep. I‚Äôll get a different app for the sounds and alarm for free.

developerResponse: {'id': 32139374, 'body': 'Thank you for the feedback, we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration, we are always looking for new ways to continue improving.', 'modified': '2022-09-21T03:49:16Z'}
review:
Nice: 
- white noise, music, recordings of snoring and animal sounds, display graphics
- it‚Äôs wonderful to see the analysis of my (extremely) rare apnea. 
Not so nice: 
- must manually start it‚Äîotherwise it doesn‚Äôt detect when you fall asleep.  I fall asleep too quickly about half the time.
- I frequently wake up for an hour or two/three/four, and the app can‚Äôt handle it.  If I leave the phone in the bedroom, it thinks I‚Äôve slept the whole time.  Very, very quietly, I guess.  If I unplug the phone and take it with me, and plug it back in, ditto.  If I tell it I‚Äôm awake, then start a new sleep session, it forgets the first one.  
I‚Äôve emailed ShutEye, got the same response we often see here ‚Ä¶ nice, but not helpful.
I‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôm going to keep looking, which is too bad‚Äîthis was so promising.
title: This App is nice, but it doesn‚Äôt answer my needs

review:
Said there was a free week trial. Nope! Bank was charged right away. Said it was a monthly charge‚Ä¶nope charged for the whole year at one time! I went to cancel the subscription after 3 days. The next year renewal is cancelled but my current subscription expires in 2024! No free week to cancel!

If someone walked past my bedroom talking it said I was awake talking in my sleep. If my cats came in my room it said I was awake. I coughed‚Ä¶nope awake. Any sound at all I‚Äôm awake. I fall asleep to the TV every night on sleep timer. As long as the TV was on it said I was awake. 

I recently had a sleep apnea test. I do not have sleep apnea. Nor am I at risk. I snore but not because of sleep apnea. This app says I stopped breathing over 30 times a night and I am at high risk. 

Severely disappointed in this app! I guess I need to go buy a new Fitbit instead!

developerResponse:
{'id': 39867984, 'body': "If you're looking to monitor your sleep and snoring patterns without using a specific app, you can try the following:

Use a voice recording app: Many smartphones have built-in voice recording apps that can record audio during the night. Place your phone close to your bed, and in the morning, review the recording for snoring sounds.

Sleep tracking devices: Consider using wearable sleep tracking devices or smartwatches that can monitor your sleep patterns and snoring. These often provide more detailed information about your sleep.

Consult a healthcare professional: If snoring is a concern for you, it might be a good idea to consult a healthcare professional or a sleep specialist who can help you assess and address the issue. They may recommend a sleep study or other diagnostic tools.

Remember that while these methods can give you some insights into your sleep patterns and snoring, for a more comprehensive and accurate assessment, it's best to consult with a healthcare provider who can provide tailored advice and solutions.", 'modified': '2023-11-01T10:33:05Z'}

developerResponse: {'id': 39002734, 'body': 'Hi\xa0Void_Exile, thanks for your feedback, I‚Äôm so sorry that our sleep tracker can‚Äôt track two people‚Äôs sleep at the same time now. ShutEye recognizes, calculates, and analyzes the files recorded by the microphone through artificial intelligence algorithms to produce your sleep status information. So two people‚Äôs noise may be regarded as one‚Äôs noise now. We consider adding a feature like this in a future update. Stay tuned, and thanks so much for helping us improve our product. Hope you can enjoy the app without it.', 'modified': '2023-09-19T08:36:12Z'}
review:
I got this app with the purpose of trying to determine if I possibly had sleep apnea. 

One thing you should know is that if you sleep with another person in the same room, the results are completely inaccurate. 
The tracker function relies entirely on your phone‚Äôs microphone. 
I didn‚Äôt get any insight into my sleep because my wife is a heavy snorer. All I got was hours of recordings of her sleeping. Not very helpful. 

The app might have potential, but I was hoping it would maybe integrate with my Apple Watch for sleep analysis, instead of entirely relying on the microphone. 

Will have to find another way to fix my problem.
title: Probably has potential, but it won‚Äôt work for me.

We hope all the different meditations and sleep sounds can send you right to bed. We also spend a lot of time making sure our library offers high-quality content.\xa0ShutEye recognizes, calculates, and analyzes the files recorded by the microphone through artificial intelligence algorithms to produce your sleep status information. Hope you can enjoy the app without it. As we‚Äôre a small developer, we currently rely on user support to help us improve quality and content. We‚Äôre doing our best to keep improving and adding new features, so we can earn that support. Thank you for the feedback, we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration, we are always looking for new ways to continue improving.', 'modified': '2022-02-25T07:54:33Z'}
review:
There are some good qualities to Shuteye:
- sleep sounds are relaxing and varied 
- it‚Äôs fun to hear sleep talking 

Here is what needs work:
- if sleeping with another human, there needs to be a way to differentiate who is sleeping and who is not 
- if sleeping with another human and they are the snorer, how does this effect the stats of the user?
- there should be more options for how the user is feeling at bedtime
- purchase price should be significantly lower 

Finally, why does the phone need to stay on the charger all night? That causes the phone to require replacement sooner.

{'id': 23240482, 'body': 'We feel so sorry for bringing such an inconvenience to you. And thank you for the feedback on ShutEye. To end the subscription, you should cancel it by the following steps on your iPhone:
1. Open the Setting.
2. Tap iTunes & App Stores.
3. Tap Apple ID and then tap View Apple ID.
4. Tap Subscription.

{'id': 32139283, 'body': "Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. 

ShutEye recognizes, calculates, and analyzes the files recorded by the microphone through artificial intelligence algorithms to produce your sleep status information.At the same time, selected sleep recordings, such as snoring, are available for your listening and sharing.For more accurate data a quiet sleep area is best. 


We provide a free trial to let our users try the premium features completely for free, before committing to pay. If you signed up for a free or discounted trial subscription and you don't want to renew it, cancel it at least 24 hours before the trial ends. Otherwise, according to the unified mechanism of Apple subscription and payment, Apple will automatically deduct the fee at the end of the trial period. If you have any problems, please feel free to contact us at shuteye_support@enerjoy.life. 

Thank you for the feedback, we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration, we are always looking for new ways to continue improving.", 'modified': '2022-09-21T03:43:12Z'}
review:
I have left less than 2-3 negative reviews of any kind in my life. However, this app is worth my time to warn others.

1.) The app is not accurate at all when categorizing noises throughout your sleep.

2.) It does not know when you‚Äôre asleep or awake.

3.) BEWARE: It will charge you a day early for a full year subscription when you select the 7 day free trial.

Try at your own risk.
title: BEWARE: 100% Do NOT Recommend
